description.narrative: (Uganda): The Communication for Healthy Communities (CHC) activity provides strategic social and behavior change communication (SBCC) support across USAID/Uganda's health and HIV portfolios. With FY 2018 funds, the activity will support Government of Uganda (GOU) and USG implementing partners to design and implement high quality SBCC interventions to increase the use of family planning (FP), including long-acting and reversible contraceptive methods targeting youth and women; improve nutrition behaviors and practices, especially in the first 1,000 days after an infant's birth; increase recognition of danger signs during pregnancy; improve uptake of antenatal care within the first 16 weeks of pregnancy; improve early and prompt health-seeking behavior at facilities for maternal, newborn, and childhood illnesses; increase prompt treatment of malaria in children; improve malaria prevention behaviors including the use of insecticide treated nets; increase tuberculosis treatment completion; and strengthen risk communication for the mitigation, preparation, and response to emerging pandemic threats and infectious disease outbreaks in Uganda... .
